level.heading: Emergency Legislation
level.text: For temporary (90 day) repeal of section, see § 3 of Cable Television Reform Emergency Amendment Act of 2002 (D.C. Act 14-409, July 15, 2002, 49 DCR 7280).

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 7-93
level.text: Law 7-93 was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 7-324, which was referred to the Committee on Government Operations. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on December 8, 1987 and January 5, 1988, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on January 25, 1988, it was assigned Act No. 7-135 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.

level.heading: Short Title
level.text: Short title: The first section of D.C. Law 7-93 provided: "That this act may be cited as the 'Cable Television Communications Act of 1981 Amendment Act of 1987'."

level.heading: Delegation of Authority
level.text: Delegation of authority pursuant to D.C. Law 7-93, the Cable Television Communications Act of 1981 Amendment Act of 1987, see Mayor's Order 90-137, October 17, 1990.
